title: [ICE]:  broken mir, -Zvalidate-mir

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
### Code

```Rust
// ./tests/ui/impl-trait/nested-return-type2.rs

// check-pass

trait Duh {}

impl Duh for i32 {}

trait Trait {
    type Assoc: Duh;
}

impl<R: Duh, F: FnMut() -> R> Trait for F {
    type Assoc = R;
}


fn foo() -> impl Trait<Assoc = impl Send> {
    || 42
}

fn main() {
}
```


### Affected release channels

- [ ] Previous Stable
- [ ] Current Stable
- [ ] Current Beta
- [ ] Current Nightly

### Rust Version

```Shell
rustc 1.69.0-nightly (d7948c843 2023-01-26)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: d7948c843de94245c794e8c63dd4301a78bb5ba3
commit-date: 2023-01-26
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.69.0-nightly
LLVM version: 15.0.7
```


### Current error output

```Shell
--> ./tests/ui/impl-trait/nested-return-type2.rs:16:4
   |
16 | fn foo() -> impl Trait<Assoc = impl Send> {
   |    ^^^
   |
   = note: `#[warn(dead_code)]` on by default

warning: opaque type `impl Trait<Assoc = impl Send>` does not satisfy its associated type bounds
  --> ./tests/ui/impl-trait/nested-return-type2.rs:16:24
   |
8  |     type Assoc: Duh;
   |                 --- this associated type bound is unsatisfied for `impl Send`
...
16 | fn foo() -> impl Trait<Assoc = impl Send> {
   |                        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: `#[warn(opaque_hidden_inferred_bound)]` on by default
help: add this bound
   |
16 | fn foo() -> impl Trait<Assoc = impl Send + Duh> {
   |                                          +++++
```
